column1: Laryngoscopy is an exam of the back of your throat, including your voice box (larynx).
Your voice box contains your vocal cords and allows you to speak.
Laryngoscopy may be done in different ways: - Indirect laryngoscopy uses a small mirror held at the back of your throat.
- Fiberoptic laryngoscopy (nasolaryngoscopy) uses a small flexible telescope.
